intro: Ulugbekia, commonly known as the "golden leaf" or "sunflower of the steppe," is a unique flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark褐色 disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Ulugbekia has a compact growth habit with a rosette of basal leaves and a single stem bearing the flower head. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
